content: How can I help you today?

I'm honestly not sure where to start. My wife and I have been having a rough time lately, mostly because we’re struggling to figure out how to help our son with his behavior. It’s gotten to the point where I can’t focus at work or enjoy anything, and it feels like everything is falling apart.
It sounds like you're carrying a lot right now, and it's deeply affecting both your family and personal well-being. What's been going on with your son that's been causing this struggle?

He’s been acting out a lot—tantrums, defiance, even trouble at school. We’ve tried different approaches, but nothing seems to work. It’s exhausting, and my wife and I end up arguing about how to handle it more often than not. I just feel like I’m failing him as a parent.

You're feeling overwhelmed and questioning yourself as a parent because of how challenging it’s been to help your son. It’s clear you care deeply about him and want to do the best for him, even though things feel so difficult right now. What’s been the hardest part for you in all of this?

Honestly, it’s the feeling of being stuck, like no matter what I try, nothing changes. It’s hard watching my son struggle and not being able to fix it. And the fighting with my wife has made me feel even more distant, like I’m letting everyone down.

Feeling stuck and unable to help can be incredibly painful, especially when you're trying so hard for your family. You’re shouldering a lot of responsibility, and it’s clear you care deeply about supporting both your son and your wife. Despite the challenges, you’re still here working through it. What do you think would help take even a small step forward—for your son, for your family, or even for yourself?
Honestly, I don’t even know anymore. It feels like no matter what I do, nothing changes. Maybe figuring out how to help my son would be a start, but I’m not sure where to even begin with that.

Not knowing where to start can feel overwhelming, but your willingness to want to help your son shows how much you care and are committed to your family. You've been putting so much effort into finding solutions, even during tough times. Would you like to explore potential ways to approach this together, or is there something you want to reflect on first?
This is hard to figure out, I’ll admit that. I think I need help even seeing what options are out there because I’m completely lost at this point. I just want us to be okay again.

It’s understandable to feel lost when trying to navigate such a difficult situation, especially when you're driven by a strong desire to keep your family close and well. That desire reflects how much you care and want things to improve for everyone. Do you feel ready to explore possible options for support or change, or is there anything else you'd like to talk about first?
I honestly just feel so beat down by everything. Maybe we can talk about some options, but it’s hard for me to see how anything will really help right now. I’m struggling to stay hopeful.

It’s tough to keep hopeful when things feel like they’re piling up, but the fact that you’re still open to talking and looking for options shows strength and a desire for change, even when it feels so heavy. Before diving into exploring options, is there anything you’d like support with for yourself first, so you're in a better place to tackle this for your family?
I think I just need to find a way to not feel so overwhelmed all the time. It’s hard to even think straight about what to do next when I feel like this.

Feeling overwhelmed can make everything feel so much harder to handle. Taking care of yourself could be a meaningful first step to make things feel more manageable. What helps you relax, even if it’s just a small thing, or might give you a bit of space to clear your mind right now?

Finding time to unwind feels impossible lately, but I used to enjoy running or even just listening to music. I haven’t done either in a while because I feel guilty taking time for myself with so much going on.

It sounds like running and listening to music were ways for you to recharge, and it’s tough feeling like you can’t prioritize that anymore. Taking a moment for yourself isn’t selfish—it’s a way to regain the energy and calm that could help you support your family even more effectively. How would it feel to dedicate even a small amount of time to one of those activities this week?

Finding time to unwind feels impossible lately, but I used to enjoy running or even just listening to music. I haven’t done either in a while because I feel guilty taking time for myself with so much going on.

Feeling guilty about prioritizing your own needs must be weighing on you, especially when you’re so focused on helping your family. Yet, taking even a little time for activities you enjoy could help you feel more grounded and better able to face the challenges ahead. What would need to happen for you to feel comfortable carving out time for running or listening to music again?

Finding time for yourself can feel really hard when everything’s so overwhelming, but it’s important to remember that taking care of yourself helps you take care of your family too. Even just a short run or a few minutes with your favorite music could give you a little space to breathe. Do you think you’d be able to set aside even 10-15 minutes to try that this week?

It sounds like setting aside even a small amount of time for yourself could feel like asking too much right now with everything going on. Still, finding just a few minutes might help you take a step toward relief without adding pressure. How would it feel to start with something very small, like listening to one song or taking a short walk?
